description: Text commentary and in-play clip coverage of Saturday's sixth round Irish Cup ties and the late kick-off between Larne and Portadown in the Premiership.
title: Irish Cup sixth round & Irish Premiership
title_page: Irish Cup sixth round & Irish Premiership - Live text updates - BBC Sport
maintext:
The final whistle
That's all from us folks on a dramatic day which saw holders Cliftonville remain on course to retain the Irish Cup they won last year.
North Belfast rivals Crusaders will form a formidable obstacle for the Reds though in the next round.
We'll be back with more Premiership text coverage on Tuesday night and then there will be live streamed coverage of the meeting of Ballymena United and league leaders Linfield on the BBC iPlayer and BBC Sport website and app.
For now though it's goodnight and enjoy what remains of your evening.
GOAL - Larne 1-1 Portadown
Steven McCullough - 76mins
All of a sudden it's all square again!
Rabby Minzamba gets to the bye-line and cuts the ball back for defender Lewis MacKinnon to fire a shot goalwards.
His effort is blocked but it falls for Steven McCullough to lash home a shot from inside the penalty area.
